subtitle: A sausage roll with a difference, this slice is perfect for packed lunches and picnics or a bonfire night feast.

method.text: Make up dough mix according to pack instructions. Roll out on a lightly floured surface to form a 28 cm x 30cm rectangle.

Down one half of the dough, arrange the cheese slices, leaving a 1 <sup>1</sup>/<sub>4</sub> cm border around the edges to allow for sealing. Lay the rashers of bacon lengthways down the dough then arrange the sausages widthways.
Scatter the onion rings over the top then bring the other half of dough over the filling, and, using a little cold water, press edges firmly together to seal.
Flute the edges. Place on a lightly greased baking tray and brush the slice with the beaten egg. Sprinkle over the remaining Cheddar and Parmesan. Cut slits in the top to allow the steam to escape.
Place in oven for 25-30 min or until cooked, golden and firm. Serve hot or cold in slices.

title: Sausage, bacon and onion slice
